description.narrative: 4.2 Government M&E and information management system progressively generate and use evidence to address the situation of children in Sri Lanka, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Sri Lanka, including the most deprived, have their human rights protected and benefit from effective child-sensitive social protection system.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND MONITORING

description.narrative: UNICEF launched a nationally representative survey to assess the impact of COVID-19 on families, being the only documented information on such issue. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional index

actual.value: 2020:HIES 2019 report will be launched by year end by the DCS and will contain child poverty measures.
